sentences: Scott Hamilton (born September 12, 1954) is an American jazz tenor saxophonist associated with swing and mainstream jazz.
He was born in Providence, Rhode Island, United States.
In 1976, he moved to New York City and played with Benny Goodman at the end of the decade.
He recorded his first significant jazz album as a leader for Chiaroscuro in 1977.
The same year, he proceeded to record his first album for Concord, with whom he maintained a long recording career as a solo act, and as a member of the Concord Jazz All Stars.
He accompanied singer Rosemary Clooney in the studio and on the road for a decade.
During the 1980s, he toured Japan, Sweden, the UK, and performed at the Grande Parade du Jazz in Nice, France.
In the 1990s, he moved to London and formed a quartet with John Pearce, Dave Green, and Steve Brown.
In 2007, he made a guest appearance at the Brecon Jazz Festival, accompanied by Humphrey Lyttelton and his band.
In 2013 and 2014, Hamilton worked with Andrea Motis and Joan Chamorro.
